revised_title: Renin-Induced Proteinuria and the Effects of Adrenalectomy: Morphological Changes and Glomerular Permeability
tldr: The study investigates the effects of renin-induced proteinuria and adrenalectomy on glomerular permeability and morphology. The researchers found that in sham-operated rats, the infusion of renin and angiotensin increased the number of tracer substance particles within endothelial cells and the basement membrane. In contrast, adrenalectomized rats showed a reduced response due to impaired renal function. The study provides insights into the sieving characteristics of the glomerular filter and the modifications induced by renin and angiotensin.
